channel.title: Not able to login with the NO-IP
channel.description: I've run fully working RS2 servers before, but now that I'm using a linksys router it isnt working. I am able to login with the 127.0.0.1, but not with my server's IP, neither is anyone else. This usually always mean I havent portforwarded, but I have. My firewall is enabled to let people through to my server. Any solutions?

item.title: Not able to login with the NO-IP
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Yes. If you have port forwarded correctly, they should be able to get to server.no-ip.org successfully. But since you are running it one YOUR computer, you have to use 127.0.0.1 to connect to it.

Read full topic
item.source: Not able to login with the NO-IP

item.title: Not able to login with the NO-IP
item.dc:creator: @Play_For_Keeps Play For Keeps
item.description:
@Play_For_Keeps wrote:

So will other people be able to use server.no-ip.org and get in successfully?

Read full topic
item.source: Not able to login with the NO-IP

item.title: Not able to login with the NO-IP
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

  1. Wrong section
  2. If you’re running the server on your Local Area Network, you MUST use 127.0.0.1. If your server’s IP was like server.no-ip.org, and you were running your server on your computer, and you tried to type in server.no-ip.org, it will NOT allow you. Here’s a visual:

Running server on your computer, and logging on to it from your computer -> IP == 127.0.0.1
Running server on your computer, but logging on to it from a different computer -> IP == server.no-ip.org
Running on VPS or other hosting, and logging on from your computer -> server.no-ip.org

Read full topic
item.source: Not able to login with the NO-IP

This usually always mean I havent portforwarded, but I have. My firewall is enabled to let people through to my server. Any solutions?
